page.title: 12CRAIG'S LIFE IN SHAWHEAD
page.content:
This is what Craig Harvey does on the farm where he lives. In June he gets up at 7.30am, has his breakfast and then feeds the calves. After that he checks for couped sheep and then has a cup of coffee at 11.00am.
After his coffee he starts silage with his dad. To get the silage in they have to cut it with a mower and lift it with a forage harvester which chops it up into little bits and puts it into a trailer. The trailer takes it to the farm, tips it and then it is buckraked up into the pit. It is then rolled, covered up and left until the winter when it is fed to the cows.
Craig has his dinner from 12.30 to 1.00pm. He would then work until 10.00pm if it was good weather. Then he will have his supper and go to bed.
